citations.narrative:
During the review of paperwork and records it was noted that the acquisition records were incomplete. All of the required
information for whom the animals were purchased from or otherwise acquired was unavailable at the time of inspection.
Appropriate documentation of acquired regulated animals is essential for proper identification, tracing forward and trace
back of the animals. The licensee must correctly document records of acquisition for all regulated animals, including
animals born on the premises, and assure that all records are kept as required. To be corrected by August 8, 2023.

citations.desc: Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being.
citations.narrative:
At the time of inspection, there was no documented program of environmental enhancement for the non-human primates
housed at the facility. An adequate environmental enhancement program is essential in promoting the psychological well-
being of non-human primates. Dealers. Exhibitors, and research facilities must develop, document, and follow an
appropriate plan for environment enhancement adequate to promote the psychological well-being of non-human primates.
To be corrected by August 8, 2023.

Multiple primary enclosures need maintenance and/or repair:
• For the enclosure housing the zebra, multiple wooden post and boards are showing signs of severe decomposition
affecting the integrity of the enclosure.
• In the pig enclosure, there is a horizontal wooden post which helps support the fence. This post shows signs of wear and
deterioration.
• The chinchilla cage shows signs of excessive wear. There is a bottom platform that contains sharp, jagged edges
suspected due to chewing. The sharp points could cause harm to the animals and degradation of enclosure can allow the
animal to escape.
Enclosures that contain sharp edges and excessive wear can cause injury or harm to the animals.
The indoor and outdoor housing facilities shall be structurally sound and shall be maintained in good repair to protect the
animals from injury and to contain the animals. To be corrected by 8/9/2023.

During inspection, a multitude of flies were located on food prep areas, in enclosures and on animals. 30 feet from the
tiger enclosure housing the female tiger Sabeena, a pile of compost was located which was used as a breeding ground
for hundreds of flies.
Large numbers of flies in animal areas can be bothersome to the animals contained and promote disease.
A safe and effective program for the control of insects, ectoparasites, and avian and mammalian pests shall be
established and maintained.
To be corrected by August 8, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
Additional Inspectors:
Charles Palmer, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
